decision_conditions: The Local Planning Authority is in possession of evidence which demonstrates that the dwellinghouse at 12 Lees Road was constructed  before 1st July 1948. The proposal would therefore not constitute permitted development under the terms of paragraph AA.1.(c), Class AA, Schedule 2, Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).

Insufficient evidence has been submitted to demonstrate that the floor to ceiling height of the proposed additional storey, measured internally, would exceed the lower: i) of 3 metres or ii) the floor to ceiling height, measured internally, of any storey of the principal part of the existing dwellinghouse. The proposal would therefore not accord with the requirements of paragraph AA.1.(h), Class AA, Schedule 2, Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).

The proposed development would adversely impact on the amenity of the neighbouring occupiers at number 10 Lees Road, in terms of loss of outlook, light, sense of enclosure and overbearing impact.  The proposal would therefore not constitute permitted development under the terms of paragraph AA.2.(3)(a)(i), Class AA, Schedule 2, Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).

The proposed development would have a significantly harmful effect on the external appearance of the dwellinghouse. The proposal would therefore not constitute permitted development under the terms of paragraph AA.2.(3)(a)(ii), Class AA, Schedule 2, Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).
description: Construction of one additional storey (Application for Prior Approval under Schedule 2, Part 1, Class AA of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended)).
